title: Bernd Wiesberger bags third victory of the season at Italian Open to beat Matt Fitzpatrick by one stroke
text:
Just five months ago, Bernd Wiesberger was 378th in the world, worrying about maintaining his status on the European Tour and being described in some quarters as a wasted talent.

Now, the Austrian heads the order of merit standings, is in the world’s top 25 and after his third success since May, boasting a big headstart in the qualifying race for next year’s Ryder Cup. That is how quickly circumstances can change in this maddening sport.

Matt Fitzpatrick would be well advised to remember that as he departed the Italian Open, bemoaning his one-shot loss. "Yeah, it was a bit crap,” the Yorkshireman said.

The 25-year-old had been desperate for his first title of the season, but a final-round 69 was hardly a disaster, despite 15-under coming up one shot short. Fitzpatrick was presented with a 30-footer to enter a play-off, but his effort slipped by.

“That double-bogey on the ninth was a killer and I’m just disappointed, because the way I played this week was fantastic,” Fitzpatrick said. "To lose by one is obviously very disappointing. I think I've played well when I've been up there on a Sunday, just other people really keep grinding and I keep coming up from behind. It is what it is. It's still a great week, I'm here to win and not here to just make up the numbers."
description: Just five months ago, Bernd Wiesberger was 378th in the world, worrying about maintaining his status on the European Tour and being described in some quarters as a wasted talent.
